description:
Takamimi Shrine has an unusual resident – Elda, an ancient elf who’s obsessed with video games! The shrine’s teenage attendant, Koito Koganei, keeps this reclusive otaku well supplied with energy drinks and junk food. Even though she loves 100%-ing her games, Elda has duties to attend to, and Koganei is bound and determined to make this otaku elf fulfill them! It’ll just take an offering or two to bribe—um, we mean convince Elda to put down her new game…

(Source: HIDIVE)
synonyms: คุณเอลฟ์โอตาคุ

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Fashion
tags.description: Centers around the fashion industry.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

node.description:
__[Website](http://shogo.strikes.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shogoy)__

__Shougo Yasukawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, series composer and lyricist.

__[Website](http://shogo.strikes.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shogoy)__

__Shougo Yasukawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, series composer and lyricist.

__[Blog (JP)](http://forte-piano.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nijine)__

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Nana Prefectural Sakurai Senior High School (2001), Osaka College of Music (2004)

__Introduction:__
Akito Matsuda, also known by his alias Nijine, is a Japanese composer and arranger. He worked freelance as a composer and arranger until his employment with Popholic found place in 2007.

__Biography:__
Akito is mainly known for working under the name Nijine, which he did between 2006 through 2012, where he wrote the soundtracks for a handful of anime while also composing and arranging various anime songs. In 2013, he decided to start using his real name for his work instead. He is also known for working on several eroge soundtracks and vocal songs under the name Tokia (stylized as TOKIA) early on in his career.

**Residency:** Tokyo, Japan

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/anzai_takebumi)**

Takefumi Anzai is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.
_Note: Not to be confused with [横山由季](https://anilist.co/staff/164104/Yuki-Yokoyama)._
**Honami Yamagishi** is a Japanese editor, who provides editing assistance to various works.

[Website](https://www.heart-company.co.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Saito_S_HC)

Produces and directs music. Founder of Heart Company.

[Blog](https://momomusic.theblog.me/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/momo_tanoue)

Mamoru Tanoue is a japanese music producer and music director. At the age of 22 he debuted as a writer at Sony Music affiliate “STARDUST”.

**Cody・Lee** is a rock band formed in August 2018 by a group of college friends.
__Members:__
-Takahashi Hibiki (高橋響) - Vocals/Guitar
-Ozaki Rino (尾崎リノ) - Vocals/Acoustic Guitar
-Riki (力毅) - Guitar/Chorus
-Nishima Kei (ニシマケイ) - Bass/Chorus
-Hara Taiki (原汰輝) - Drums/Chorus
__[Website](https://codyleeofficial.com/)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/codylee_official/)__ | __[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRwlGbdH79F2LgnhbDyN5gg)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/C_D_Y_L)__

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/wanuka__) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCm7rYZ6xOw3m5GaTMuUJjVw)
 
He is a mysterious singer-songwriter who hasn't revealed his face or his background, only that he's a 22-year-old college student.
His distinctly Japanese, somehow nostalgic, musical style, and addictive melodies are drawing an enthusiastic response, mostly on social media.

The music video for his first original song, ["Tipsy"](https://youtu.be/Rq0NjgXSj0s), has surpassed 20 million views.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/wanuka__) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCm7rYZ6xOw3m5GaTMuUJjVw)
 
He is a mysterious singer-songwriter who hasn't revealed his face or his background, only that he's a 22-year-old college student.
His distinctly Japanese, somehow nostalgic, musical style, and addictive melodies are drawing an enthusiastic response, mostly on social media.

The music video for his first original song, ["Tipsy"](https://youtu.be/Rq0NjgXSj0s), has surpassed 20 million views.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/100outo) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZAgssIVgZSOv8UxjRd2knQ)

100kaiOuto is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and music producer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miketukami3) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/4704176) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=shunsuke_aoki)

Originally from [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858), mentored by [Takuma Ebisu](https://anilist.co/staff/138756). Currently a freelancer.
